repnme.cdata!: India - Punjab Irrigation and Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The general outcome of the Punjab
            Irrigation and Drainage Project is deemed unsatisfactory
            with unlikely sustainability. The project was successful in
            implementing most of its physical targets, however,
            institutional strengthening components and the performance
            of the borrower in providing a supportive policy and funding
            environment has been disappointing. The key lessons learned
            centered around the needs of a project in several areas
            including: a) a strategy and broader conceptual framework;
            b) sustainable water pricing and operation and maintenance;
            c) participatory irrigation management and water user
            associations; d) institutional development; e) integration
            with agricultural development; f) coordination between
            governmental agencies; and g) multi-disciplinary bank and
            borrower staff inputs.

18218298.theme: Pollution management and environmental health,Rural services and infrastructure
18218298.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

repnme.cdata!:
India - Second Punjab Irrigation and
            Drainage Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's objectives are to
            improve the productivity of the existing irrigation systems,
            raise living standards through the development of irrigation
            facilities, initiate drainage works, trials and studies to
            address the various impacts of the rising water table in the
            state of Punjab and finally, upgrade the efficiency and
            skills of the Irrigation Department. The project's
            components are the following : 1) improved irrigation
            efficiency, 2) agricultural development in the poorest areas
            of the state by developing the Kandi Canal, constructing
            public tubewells and low dams in the Kandi tract, as well as
            lift irrigation facilities in areas adjoining the Sutlej -
            Yamuna link canal, 3) drainage works, and 4) institutional development.

docna.cdata!:
India - Second Punjab Irrigation and
